How to use this template

This is a Quarto website template, made for the Omni Institute.

Create a new website

The {omni} package contains a create_website() function that will create a new directory (named my_report in the example below) with default files to get you started.

library(omni)

create_website("my_report")

Once you created the new directory, it’ll open the main Quarto page, named index.qmd. Hit the Render button and you should be able to preview your website.

Add or remove a page

To add/remove a page, you must do two things:

  • Create (or delete) the page you want to add (or remove). By default, the website has three pages: index.qmd, customization.qmd and about.qmd. Let’s say we want to add an “Appendix” page, we create an appendix.qmd file next to other Quarto documents.
  • Add (or remove) the page to _quarto.yml configuration file. Default _quarto.yml looks like this:
website:
  navbar:
    left:
      - href: index.qmd
        text: Home
      - href: about.qmd
        text: Use this template
      - href: customization.qmd
        text: Customization

We can add our Appendix page by adding:

- href: appendix.qmd
  text: Appendix

This gives us:

Warning

The href attribute above should match exactly the name of the file you created, while the text attribute can be whatever you want since it’s just what will be in the navigation bar.
